title: Shooting suspect turns himself in
content:
Rocky Mount police have arrested a man wanted in connection to a shooting on Dec. 8
Police Cpl. Mike Lewis said Jawon Braswell, 19, of Rocky Mount turned himself in to police at 6:41 p.m. at 330 South Church St. Braswell was wanted in connection with a shooting involving a 17-year-old man at a house on the 400 block of Cascade Street.
The victim was taken to Nash UNC Health Care with non-life-threatening injuries, treated and released. Lewis said warrants were taken out against Braswell for attempted first-degree murder and assault with a deadly weapon following the shooting.
Braswell is being held in the Nash County Detention Center under an $850,000 secured bond. His first court date is today. According to court records, Braswell will face the attempted first-degree murder charge and a felony charge of robbery with a dangerous weapon.
